name: Risperidone
summary: Risperidone is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and irritability in autism.
description: Risperidone is an atypical antipsychotic medication that works primarily through antagonism of dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors. It is indicated for the treatment of schizophrenia, acute manic or mixed episodes associated with bipolar I disorder, and irritability associated with autism spectrum disorder. Risperidone can be administered orally as tablets, orally disintegrating tablets, or oral solution. It is effective in reducing positive and negative symptoms of psychosis and stabilizing mood.

off_label_uses: Behavioral symptoms in dementia (not recommended in elderly with dementia-related psychosis)
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to risperidone or formulation components

items: Acute manic or mixed episodes in bipolar I disorder (monotherapy or adjunctive therapy)

sections.text: Antagonizes dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors, reducing psychotic symptoms and stabilizing mood. Also affects alpha-adrenergic and histamine H1 receptors.

adult.schizophrenia: Start 2 mg/day; may increase to 4–8 mg/day based on response

items: Tablets: 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg, 1 mg, 2 mg, 3 mg, 4 mg
Orally disintegrating tablets: 0.5 mg, 1 mg, 2 mg, 3 mg, 4 mg

sections.text: Symptom improvement may be seen within 1–2 weeks; full response may take several weeks.

serious: increased mortality in elderly with dementia-related psychosis

other: Increased mortality in elderly with dementia-related psychosis
Metabolic risks: weight gain, dyslipidemia, hyperglycemia

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefit outweighs risk; limited human data
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; consider alternative or monitor infant

sections.text: Reduce gradually over 1–2 weeks to avoid withdrawal or relapse.

items: Consider oral overlap when transitioning from LAI
Prolactin elevation is more common compared to some other atypical antipsychotics
